00042 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00043 //  CLASS : sc_in_rv<W>
00044 //
00045 //  The sc_signal_rv<W> input port class.
00046 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00047 
00048 template <int W>
00049 class sc_in_rv
00050     : public sc_in<sc_dt::sc_lv<W> >
00051 {
00052 public:
00053 
00054     // typedefs
00055 
00056     typedef sc_dt::sc_lv<W>                     data_type;
00057 
00058     typedef sc_in_rv<W>                         this_type;
00059     typedef sc_in<data_type>                    base_type;
00060 
00061     typedef typename base_type::in_if_type      in_if_type;
00062     typedef typename base_type::in_port_type    in_port_type;
00063     typedef typename base_type::inout_port_type inout_port_type;
00064 
00065 public:
00066 
00067     // constructors
00068 
00069     sc_in_rv()
00070         : base_type()
00071         {}
00072 
00073     explicit sc_in_rv( const char* name_ )
00074         : base_type( name_ )
00075         {}
00076 
00077     explicit sc_in_rv( const in_if_type& interface_ )
00078         : base_type( interface_ )
00079         {}
00080 
00081     sc_in_rv( const char* name_, const in_if_type& interface_ )
00082         : base_type( name_, interface_ )
00083         {}
00084 
00085     explicit sc_in_rv( in_port_type& parent_ )
00086         : base_type( parent_ )
00087         {}
00088 
00089     sc_in_rv( const char* name_, in_port_type& parent_ )
00090         : base_type( name_, parent_ )
00091         {}
00092 
00093     explicit sc_in_rv( inout_port_type& parent_ )
00094         : base_type( parent_ )
00095         {}
00096 
00097     sc_in_rv( const char* name_, inout_port_type& parent_ )
00098         : base_type( name_, parent_ )
00099         {}
00100 
00101     sc_in_rv( this_type& parent_ )
00102         : base_type( parent_ )
00103         {}
00104 
00105     sc_in_rv( const char* name_, this_type& parent_ )
00106         : base_type( name_, parent_ )
00107         {}
00108 
00109 
00110     // destructor (does nothing)
00111 
00112     virtual ~sc_in_rv()
00113         {}
00114 
00115 
00116     // called when elaboration is done
00117     /*  WHEN DEFINING THIS METHOD IN A DERIVED CLASS, */
00118     /*  MAKE SURE THAT THIS METHOD IS CALLED AS WELL. */
00119 
00120     virtual void end_of_elaboration();
00121 
00122     virtual const char* kind() const
00123         { return "sc_in_rv"; }
00124 
00125 private:
00126 
00127     // disabled
00128     sc_in_rv( const this_type& );
00129     this_type& operator = ( const this_type& );
00130 };
00131 
00132 
00133 // IIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIII
00134 
00135 
00136 // called when elaboration is done
00137 
00138 template <int W>
00139 void
00140 sc_in_rv<W>::end_of_elaboration()
00141 {
00142     base_type::end_of_elaboration();
00143     // check if bound channel is a resolved signal
00144     if( dynamic_cast<sc_signal_rv<W>*>( this->get_interface() ) == 0 ) {
00145         this->report_error( SC_ID_RESOLVED_PORT_NOT_BOUND_, 0 );
00146     }
00147 }
00148 
00149 
00150 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00151 //  CLASS : sc_inout_rv<W>
00152 //
00153 //  The sc_signal_rv<W> input/output port class.
00154 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00155 
00156 template <int W>
00157 class sc_inout_rv
00158     : public sc_inout<sc_dt::sc_lv<W> >
00159 {
00160 public:
00161 
00162     // typedefs
00163 
00164     typedef sc_dt::sc_lv<W>                     data_type;
00165 
00166     typedef sc_inout_rv<W>                      this_type;
00167     typedef sc_inout<data_type>                 base_type;
00168 
00169     typedef typename base_type::in_if_type      in_if_type;
00170     typedef typename base_type::in_port_type    in_port_type;
00171     typedef typename base_type::inout_if_type   inout_if_type;
00172     typedef typename base_type::inout_port_type inout_port_type;
00173 
00174 public:
00175 
00176     // constructors
00177 
00178     sc_inout_rv()
00179         : base_type()
00180         {}
00181 
00182     explicit sc_inout_rv( const char* name_ )
00183         : base_type( name_ )
00184         {}
00185 
00186     explicit sc_inout_rv( inout_if_type& interface_ )
00187         : base_type( interface_ )
00188         {}
00189 
00190     sc_inout_rv( const char* name_, inout_if_type& interface_ )
00191         : base_type( name_, interface_ )
00192         {}
00193 
00194     explicit sc_inout_rv( inout_port_type& parent_ )
00195         : base_type( parent_ )
00196         {}
00197 
00198     sc_inout_rv( const char* name_, inout_port_type& parent_ )
00199         : base_type( name_, parent_ )
00200         {}
00201 
00202     sc_inout_rv( this_type& parent_ )
00203         : base_type( parent_ )
00204         {}
00205 
00206     sc_inout_rv( const char* name_, this_type& parent_ )
00207         : base_type( name_, parent_ )
00208         {}
00209 
00210 
00211     // destructor (does nothing)
00212 
00213     virtual ~sc_inout_rv()
00214         {}
00215 
00216 
00217     // write the new value
00218 
00219     this_type& operator = ( const data_type& value_ )
00220         { (*this)->write( value_ ); return *this; }
00221 
00222     this_type& operator = ( const in_if_type& interface_ )
00223         { (*this)->write( interface_.read() ); return *this; }
00224 
00225     this_type& operator = ( const in_port_type& port_ )
00226         { (*this)->write( port_->read() ); return *this; }
00227 
00228     this_type& operator = ( const inout_port_type& port_ )
00229         { (*this)->write( port_->read() ); return *this; }
00230 
00231     this_type& operator = ( const this_type& port_ )
00232         { (*this)->write( port_->read() ); return *this; }
00233 
00234 
00235     // called when elaboration is done
00236     /*  WHEN DEFINING THIS METHOD IN A DERIVED CLASS, */
00237     /*  MAKE SURE THAT THIS METHOD IS CALLED AS WELL. */
00238 
00239     virtual void end_of_elaboration();
00240 
00241     virtual const char* kind() const
00242         { return "sc_inout_rv"; }
00243 
00244 private:
00245 
00246     // disabled
00247     sc_inout_rv( const this_type& );
00248 };

00254 // called when elaboration is done
00255 
00256 template <int W>
00257 void
00258 sc_inout_rv<W>::end_of_elaboration()
00259 {
00260     base_type::end_of_elaboration();
00261     // check if bound channel is a resolved signal
00262     if( dynamic_cast<sc_signal_rv<W>*>( this->get_interface() ) == 0 ) {
00263         this->report_error( SC_ID_RESOLVED_PORT_NOT_BOUND_, 0 );
00264     }
00265 }

00268 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00269 //  CLASS : sc_out_rv<W>
00270 //
00271 //  The sc_signal_rv<W> output port class.
00272 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00273 
00274 // sc_out_rv can also read from its port, hence no difference with
00275 // sc_inout_rv. For debugging reasons, a class is provided instead
00276 // of a define.
00277 
00278 template <int W>
00279 class sc_out_rv
00280     : public sc_inout_rv<W>
00281 {
00282 public:
00283 
00284     // typedefs
00285 
00286     typedef sc_out_rv<W>                        this_type;
00287     typedef sc_inout_rv<W>                      base_type;
00288 
00289     typedef typename base_type::data_type       data_type;
00290 
00291     typedef typename base_type::in_if_type      in_if_type;
00292     typedef typename base_type::in_port_type    in_port_type;
00293     typedef typename base_type::inout_if_type   inout_if_type;
00294     typedef typename base_type::inout_port_type inout_port_type;
00295 
00296 public:
00297 
00298     // constructors
00299 
00300     sc_out_rv()
00301         : base_type()
00302         {}
00303 
00304     explicit sc_out_rv( const char* name_ )
00305         : base_type( name_ )
00306         {}
00307 
00308     explicit sc_out_rv( inout_if_type& interface_ )
00309         : base_type( interface_ )
00310         {}
00311 
00312     sc_out_rv( const char* name_, inout_if_type& interface_ )
00313         : base_type( name_, interface_ )
00314         {}
00315 
00316     explicit sc_out_rv( inout_port_type& parent_ )
00317         : base_type( parent_ )
00318         {}
00319 
00320     sc_out_rv( const char* name_, inout_port_type& parent_ )
00321         : base_type( name_, parent_ )
00322         {}
00323 
00324     sc_out_rv( this_type& parent_ )
00325         : base_type( parent_ )
00326         {}
00327 
00328     sc_out_rv( const char* name_, this_type& parent_ )
00329         : base_type( name_, parent_ )
00330         {}
00331 
00332 
00333     // destructor (does nothing)
00334 
00335     virtual ~sc_out_rv()
00336         {}
00337 
00338 
00339     // write the new value
00340 
00341     this_type& operator = ( const data_type& value_ )
00342         { (*this)->write( value_ ); return *this; }
00343 
00344     this_type& operator = ( const in_if_type& interface_ )
00345         { (*this)->write( interface_.read() ); return *this; }
00346 
00347     this_type& operator = ( const in_port_type& port_ )
00348         { (*this)->write( port_->read() ); return *this; }
00349 
00350     this_type& operator = ( const inout_port_type& port_ )
00351         { (*this)->write( port_->read() ); return *this; }
00352 
00353     this_type& operator = ( const this_type& port_ )
00354         { (*this)->write( port_->read() ); return *this; }
00355 
00356     virtual const char* kind() const
00357         { return "sc_out_rv"; }
00358 
00359 private:
00360 
00361     // disabled
00362     sc_out_rv( const this_type& );
00363 };
